verses.verse: Behold<WH2005> my servant,<WH5650> whom I uphold;<WH8551> my elect,<WH972> in whom my soul<WH5315> delights;<WH7521> I have put<WH5414> my spirit<WH7307> on him: he shall bring<WH3318> forth<WH3318> judgment<WH4941> to the Gentiles.<WH1471>
He shall not cry,<WH6817> nor<WH3808> lift<WH5375> up, nor<WH3808> cause his voice<WH6963> to be heard<WH8085> in the street.<WH2351>
A bruised<WH7533> reed<WH7070> shall he not break,<WH7665> and the smoking<WH3544> flax<WH6594> shall he not quench:<WH3518> he shall bring<WH3318> forth<WH3318> judgment<WH4941> to truth.<WH571>
He shall not fail<WH3543> nor<WH3808> be discouraged,<WH7533> till<WH5704> he have set<WH7760> judgment<WH4941> in the earth:<WH776> and the isles<WH339> shall wait<WH3176> for his law.<WH8451>

Thus<WH3541> said<WH559> God<WH410> the LORD,<WH3068> he that created<WH1254> the heavens,<WH8064> and stretched<WH5186> them out; he that spread<WH7554> forth the earth,<WH776> and that which comes<WH6631> out of it; he that gives<WH5414> breath<WH5397> to the people<WH5971> on it, and spirit<WH7307> to them that walk<WH1980> therein:

I the LORD<WH3068> have called<WH7121> you in righteousness,<WH6664> and will hold<WH2388> your hand,<WH3027> and will keep<WH5341> you, and give<WH5414> you for a covenant<WH1285> of the people,<WH5971> for a light<WH216> of the Gentiles;<WH1471>

To open<WH6491> the blind<WH5787> eyes,<WH5869> to bring<WH3318> out the prisoners<WH616> from the prison,<WH4525> and them that sit<WH3427> in darkness<WH2822> out of the prison<WH3608> house.<WH1004>
I am the LORD:<WH3068> that is my name:<WH8034> and my glory<WH3519> will I not give<WH5414> to another,<WH312> neither my praise<WH8416> to graven<WH6456> images.
Behold,<WH2009> the former<WH7223> things are come<WH935> to pass, and new<WH2319> things do I declare:<WH5046> before<WH2962> they spring<WH6779> forth I tell<WH8085> you of them.

Sing<WH7891> to the LORD<WH3068> a new<WH2319> song,<WH7892> and his praise<WH8416> from the end<WH7097> of the earth,<WH776> you that go<WH3381> down<WH3381> to the sea,<WH3220> and all<WH4393> that is therein;<WH4393> the isles,<WH339> and the inhabitants<WH3427> thereof.

Let the wilderness<WH4057> and the cities<WH5892> thereof lift<WH5375> up their voice, the villages<WH2691> that Kedar<WH6938> does inhabit:<WH3427> let the inhabitants<WH3427> of the rock<WH5553> sing,<WH7442> let them shout<WH6681> from the top<WH7218> of the mountains.<WH2022>
Let them give<WH7760> glory<WH3519> to the LORD,<WH3068> and declare<WH5046> his praise<WH8416> in the islands.<WH339>

The LORD<WH3068> shall go<WH3318> forth<WH3318> as a mighty<WH1368> man,<WH376> he shall stir<WH5782> up jealousy<WH7068> like a man<WH376> of war:<WH4421> he shall cry,<WH7321> yes,<WH637> roar;<WH6873> he shall prevail<WH1396> against<WH5921> his enemies.<WH341>

I have long<WH5769> time held<WH2814> my peace;<WH2814> I have been still,<WH2790> and refrained<WH662> myself: now will I cry<WH6463> like a travailing<WH3205> woman; I will destroy<WH5395> and devour<WH7602> at<WH3162> once.<WH3162>

I will make<WH7760> waste<WH2717> mountains<WH2022> and hills,<WH1389> and dry<WH3001> up all<WH3605> their herbs;<WH6212> and I will make<WH7760> the rivers<WH5103> islands,<WH339> and I will dry<WH3001> up the pools.<WH98>

And I will bring<WH3212> the blind<WH5787> by a way<WH1870> that they knew<WH3045> not; I will lead<WH1869> them in paths<WH5410> that they have not known:<WH3045> I will make<WH7760> darkness<WH4285> light<WH216> before<WH6440> them, and crooked<WH4625> things straight.<WH4334> These<WH428> things<WH1697> will I do<WH6213> to them, and not forsake<WH5800> them.
They shall be turned<WH5472> back,<WH268> they shall be greatly ashamed,<WH954> that trust<WH982> in graven<WH6459> images, that say<WH559> to the molten<WH4541> images, You are our gods.<WH430>
Hear,<WH8085> you deaf;<WH2795> and look,<WH5027> you blind,<WH5787> that you may see.<WH7200>

Who<WH4310> is blind,<WH5787> but my servant?<WH5650> or deaf,<WH2795> as my messenger<WH4397> that I sent?<WH7971> who<WH4310> is blind<WH5787> as he that is perfect,<WH7999> and blind<WH5787> as the LORD's<WH3068> servant?<WH5650>
Seeing<WH7200> many<WH7227> things, but you observe<WH8104> not; opening<WH6491> the ears,<WH241> but he hears<WH8085> not.
The LORD<WH3068> is well<WH2654> pleased<WH2654> for his righteousness'<WH6664> sake;<WH4616> he will magnify<WH1431> the law,<WH8451> and make it honorable.<WH142>

But this<WH1931> is a people<WH5971> robbed<WH962> and spoiled;<WH8154> they are all<WH3605> of them snared<WH6351> in holes,<WH2356> and they are hid<WH2244> in prison<WH3608> houses:<WH1004> they are for a prey,<WH957> and none<WH369> delivers;<WH5337> for a spoil,<WH4933> and none<WH369> said,<WH559> Restore.<WH7725>
Who<WH4310> among you will give ear<WH238> to this?<WH2063> who will listen<WH7181> and hear<WH8085> for the time<WH268> to come?

Who<WH4310> gave<WH5414> Jacob<WH3290> for a spoil,<WH4882> and Israel<WH3478> to the robbers?<WH962> did not the LORD,<WH3068> he against whom<WH2098> we have sinned?<WH2398> for they would<WH14> not walk<WH1980> in his ways,<WH1870> neither<WH3808> were they obedient<WH8085> to his law.<WH8451>

Therefore he has poured<WH8210> on him the fury<WH2534> of his anger,<WH639> and the strength<WH5807> of battle:<WH4421> and it has set<WH7760> him on fire<WH3857> round<WH5439> about, yet he knew<WH3045> not; and it burned<WH1197> him, yet he laid<WH7760> it not to heart.<WH3820>
